intro: Dalechampia hutchisoniana, commonly known as the red-veined dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Dalechampia hutchisoniana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage.
